Narrative:
Wroblewski's current contract only allows him to coach the American women during the world championships in Denmark in August. 

He takes over for Joel Johnson, who is leaving down after a year to coach the women's programme at the University of St. Thomas. 

US News reported that Wroblewski takes over an older US team that is in transition after losing to Canada in both the Beijing Winter Games in February and the world championships in August, settling for silver medals. After losing four straight games in international competition over the past year, the Americans failed to match the Canadians' speed and up-tempo style of play.

Wroblewski has spent the past two seasons coaching the Los Angeles Kings’ American Hockey League affiliate, the Ontario Reign.

From Neenah, Wisconsin, the 41-year-old Wroblewski is best known for his four years at the National Team Development Program.
Title: Meet the US Women's Hockey Head Coach
